entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French acorder, from Vulgar Latin *accordare, from Latin ad- + cord-, cor heart heart

def.dt: :to grant or give especially as appropriate, due, or earned
:to be consistent or in harmony :agree usually used with with a theory that accords with the known facts

entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French acord, from acorder

def.dt: :agreement conformity acted in accord with the company's policy
:voluntary or spontaneous impulse to act gave generously of their own accord
